channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us

item.title: Latest remains returned to Israel from Gaza are not bodies of hostages, Israel says
item.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — The remains of three people handed over by Hamas to the Red Cross this week do not belong to any of the hostages, Israel said Saturday, the latest development that could undermine the U.S.-brokered agreement for a ceasefire in the Israel-Hamas war.
item.dc:creator: RENATA BRITO, Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: Pakistan partially reopens Torkham border crossing to allow Afghan refugees to leave
item.description: PESHAWAR, Pakistan (AP) — Pakistan on Saturday partially reopened the Torkham border crossing with Afghanistan to allow thousands of stranded Afghan refugees to return home, officials said. Restrictions remain on all other cross-border movement, including trade.
item.dc:creator: RIAZ KHAN, Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: Heidi Klum reveals her much-anticipated 2025 Halloween costume
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Heidi Klum donned green scales and squirming snakes to transform herself into Medusa for Halloween on Friday.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: Federal judge rules Trump can’t require citizenship proof on the federal voting form
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — President Donald Trump’s request to add a documentary proof of citizenship requirement to the federal voter registration form cannot be enforced, a federal judge ruled Friday. U.S. District Judge Colleen Kollar-Kotelly in Washington, D.C.
item.dc:creator: ALI SWENSON and NICHOLAS RICCARDI, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Military strikes on Venezuela appear increasingly likely
item.description: The U.S. launching strikes within Venezuela is looking increasingly likely as the Trump administration continues to bolster the buildup of military assets in the region, turning up the pressure against Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro, whom U.S.
item.dc:creator: Filip Timotija, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Judges order SNAP funding to continue as shutdown threatens food assistance for many Illinois families
item.description: Two federal judges ruled that the Trump administration must continue funding SNAP during the government shutdown, using contingency dollars if necessary, to ensure that the 2 million Illinoisans who rely on the program can access healthy food.
item.dc:creator: Julian Crews, WGN 9

item.title: Blood pressure medication recalled over potential carcinogen: What to know
item.description: Nearly 590,000 bottles of blood pressure drugs have been recalled over concerns that they may contain a potentially carcinogenic chemical that exceeds the “acceptable intake limit.
item.dc:creator: Michael Bartiromo, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: LA fire crews told to abandon smoldering blaze that reignited as Palisades Fire: Report
item.description: That blaze grew into the Palisades Fire, which killed 12 people and devastated the Pacific Palisades.
item.dc:creator: Cameron Kiszla, NewsNation

item.title: Police investigating break-in at home reported to belong to NBA star Shai Gilgeous-Alexander
item.description: Police on Friday were investigating a burglary at a home reported to belong to the Oklahoma City Thunder’s Shai Gilgeous-Alexander that happened while the NBA's reigning MVP was playing a game the night before.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Multiple people have been arrested in Michigan in a Halloween weekend attack plot, FBI director says
item.description: DEARBORN, Mich. (AP) — Multiple people who had been allegedly plotting a violent attack over the Halloween weekend were arrested Friday in Michigan, FBI Director Kash Patel said in a social media post. The law enforcement effort was focused on suburban Detroit.
item.dc:creator: MIKE HOUSEHOLDER and ERIC TUCKER, Associated Press, KREX 5

item.title: FDA restricts use of kids' fluoride supplements citing emerging health risks
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Food and Drug Administration on Friday moved to limit the use of fluoride supplements used to strengthen children's teeth, the latest action by Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. and his deputies against a chemical that is a mainstay of dental care.
item.dc:creator: MATTHEW PERRONE, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Utah redistricting battle: Small city split into four congressional districts
item.description: The city's division means residents can cross different congressional districts simply by visiting nearby businesses.
item.dc:creator: Brian Entin, NewsNation

item.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs transferred to New Jersey prison to serve 4-year prostitution-related sentence
item.description: Sean “Diddy” Combs has been transferred to a prison in New Jersey to serve out the remainder of his four-year prison sentence on prostitution-related charges.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: EA reports decrease in sales, lose content creators amid buyout
item.description: EA has reported a 13% dip in overall sales of $1.81 billion despite significant gains in its Madden NFL and Sports FC franchises.
item.dc:creator: Cher Hwang, NewsNation

item.title: Judge orders arrest of ex-Green Beret tied to failed Venezuela raid after court no-show
item.description: TAMPA, Fla. (AP) — A federal judge in Tampa has ordered the arrest of a former Green Beret accused of plotting to invade Venezuela in 2020 after he failed to show up to court for a hearing on whether he should be taken back into custody for violating the conditions of his pre-trial release.
item.dc:creator: CURT ANDERSON and JOSHUA GOODMAN, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Monkey escape in Mississippi gives a glimpse into the secretive world of animal research
item.description: The recent escape of several research monkeys after the truck carrying them overturned on a Mississippi interstate is the latest glimpse into the secretive industry of animal research and the processes that allow key details of what happened to be kept from the public.
item.dc:creator: JEFF MARTIN, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Instacart, DoorDash, Gopuff among companies offering discounts to SNAP recipients
item.description: Instacart said Friday it will offer customers who receive SNAP benefits 50% on their next grocery order to ease strain as the government prepares to cut off food aid payments.
item.dc:creator: DEE-ANN DURBIN, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: When will SNAP EBT cards be reloaded? Delays still possible despite judges' rulings
item.description: Just hours before the looming deadline, two judges ruled Friday that the federal government must continue funding SNAP during the government shut down. However, those expecting food assistance on Nov. 1 may still see delays.
item.dc:creator: Alix Martichoux, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: How hunger relief groups say you can help feed your neighbors during the shutdown and beyond
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Your neighbors might soon need extra assistance putting food on the table. The U.S. Department of Agriculture planned on Nov. 1 to begin freezing food aid payments used by about 1 in 8 Americans for groceries.
item.dc:creator: JAMES POLLARD, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: South Carolina man chooses execution by firing squad despite concerns over last death by bullets
item.description: COLUMBIA, S.C. (AP) — A man on death row in South Carolina who taunted investigators with messages written with a victim's blood chose Friday to die by firing squad. Stephen Bryant, 44, will be the third man this year to die by South Carolina's newest execution method. His execution is set for Nov.
item.dc:creator: JEFFREY COLLINS, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Republicans battling behind scenes over funding SNAP during shutdown
item.description: Cracks are forming in the Senate GOP conference over whether benefits under the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) should be allowed to lapse this weekend.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Bolton, KRON4

item.title: A solid gold toilet is up for auction with a $10 million starting price
item.description: LONDON (AP) — For sale: The world’s most valuable toilet, a lavatory literally worth its weight in gold. Sotheby’s announced Friday that it will auction off the solid gold cistern, a sculpture by Italian artist Maurizio Cattelan entitled “America.
item.dc:creator: JILL LAWLESS Associated Press, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Trump says Senate should scrap the filibuster to end the government shutdown
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Donald Trump is calling on the Senate to scrap the filibuster, so that the Republican majority can bypass Democrats and reopen the federal government.
item.dc:creator: LISA MASCARO AP Congressional Correspondent, WFLA, NBC

item.title: DHS rule expands facial recognition to all US ports of entry for foreign travelers
item.description: DHS is expanding facial recognition technology to all U.S. ports of entry, requiring photos of foreigners, including green card holders, when entering or leaving the country.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: King Charles III strips Prince Andrew of titles and evicts him from royal residence
item.description: King Charles III is stripping his brother Prince Andrew of his remaining titles and evicting him from his royal residence, Buckingham Palace said Thursday.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: RFK Jr. says no 'sufficient' evidence Tylenol definitively causes autism
item.description: Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. said there is not “sufficient” evidence that Tylenol causes autism, softening warnings he and President Trump have repeatedly made to discourage the medicine's use by pregnant women and young children.
item.dc:creator: Nathaniel Weixel, NewsNation

item.title: Maryland state senator indicted in alleged scheme involving filming critic in bed
item.description: Federal prosecutors unsealed criminal charges against a Maryland state lawmaker Thursday, accusing her of blackmailing a political critic by secretly recording them in bed with a married man. State Sen.
item.dc:creator: Zach Schonfeld, WGN 9

item.title: Cop's testimony, judge's instructions influenced outcome of Sonya Massey murder case
item.description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill. (AP) — The killing of Sonya Massey in her home by an Illinois sheriff's deputy was pursued by prosecutors as a first-degree murder case with a possible life prison sentence. Then the judge gave the jury another option when deliberations began this week.
item.dc:creator: JOHN O'CONNOR and ED WHITE, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Trump sets 7,500 annual limit for refugees entering US. It'll be mostly white South Africans
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Trump administration is restricting the number of refugees admitted annually to the United States to 7,500 and they will mostly be white South Africans, a dramatic drop announced Thursday that effectively suspends America's traditional role as a haven for those fleeing war and
item.dc:creator: REBECCA SANTANA, Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Teacher who was shot by 6-year-old student at school testifies she thought she had died
item.description: A former Virginia teacher who was shot by a 6-year-old student in her classroom in 2023 testified Thursday that she thought she had died that day.
item.dc:creator: JOHN RABY, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Trump, Xi agree to ease trade war in high-stakes meeting
item.description: President Donald Trump announced an agreement with Chinese President Xi Jinping to ease their trade war following a meeting Thursday, with the U.S. scaling back tariffs and China delaying export controls and resuming some soybean purchases.
item.dc:creator: Julia Manchester, Fox 5

item.title: Trump directs Pentagon to start testing nuclear weapons
item.description: President Trump said Wednesday that he has instructed the Defense Department to immediately begin testing U.S. nuclear weapons on an equal basis to China and Russia. “The United States has more Nuclear Weapons than any other country,” Trump wrote.
item.dc:creator: Filip Timotija, WGN 9

item.title: Pulled pork sandwiches recalled over plastic contamination
item.description: The E.A. Sween Company announced this week that it is recalling a brand of its pulled pork sandwiches over concerns that there may be plastic pieces in them.
item.dc:creator: Jordan Perkins, WGN 9

item.title: 5 more arrests made in Louvre jewel heist
item.description: PARIS (AP) — Five more people have been arrested in the investigation into the theft of crown jewels from the Louvre Museum, but the treasures remain missing, the Paris prosecutor announced Thursday.
item.dc:creator: ANGELA CHARLTON and THOMAS ADAMSON Associated Press, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Melodee Buzzard: What we know about the California 9-year-old's disappearance
item.description: Security camera images released by the sheriff's office from inside the car rental business are believed to be the first new images taken of Melodee in more than two years.
item.dc:creator: Travis Schlepp, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Putin claims Russian troops have surrounded 2 Ukrainian cities but Ukraine says that's not true
item.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Russian President Vladimir Putin claimed Wednesday that Russian troops have surrounded Ukrainian forces in two key eastern cities of Ukraine and offered to negotiate a deal for their surrender. Ukrainian military officials vigorously denied the claim.
item.dc:creator: ILLIA NOVIKOV, Associated Press, KTLA 5

item.title: VIDEO: Ground washes out just feet from Florida homes after nearly 18 inches of rainfall
item.description: Some central Florida roads and yards were left washed out and heavily damaged after weekend storms dumped over a foot of rain in some spots.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Tucker, Fox 5
